intro: Ipomoea taborana, commonly known as the Tabor morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant is a vigorous climber with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms that open in the morning and close at dusk. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other well-known morning glories.
